snippet: The chief executive at General Motors, Mary T. Barra, wants to ensure that deadly failures never happen again, but old habits are hard to change.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column argues that depth of dysfunction revealed by internal report at General Motors calls into question whether chief executive Mary T Barra can deliver on promise of reform; examines trends of secrecy and accountability avoidance at company, noting that they have regrettably become commonplace across corporate America.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive at General Motors, Mary T. Barra, wants to ensure that deadly failures never happen again, but old habits are hard to change.

headline.seo: Gretchen Morgenson on the Problems at G.M.
headline.main: A Vow to End Hollow Nods and Salutes
